details.flavorText: Jann are genies composed of all four elements, meaning they are not quite home on any of the Elemental Planes. Instead, jann reside on the Material Plane, making only brief forays to the other parts of the Inner Sphere. Although they are human in size and appearance, jann are not at all related to humans and bristle at any claims to this effect. They are a proud people and take great care to maintain their honor-restoring that honor with the edge of a sword, if necessary.

languages.custom: one elemental language (Aquan, Auran, Ignan, or Terran), one planar language (Abyssal, Celestial, or Infernal), telepathy 100 feet

description.value: You and your allies traverse the barriers between planes of existence. The targets move to another plane, such as the Plane of Fire, the Shadow Plane, or the Abyss. You must have specific knowledge of the destination plane and use a magic tuning fork created from material from that plane as a focus for the spell. While the tuning forks for most prominent planes are uncommon, just like the spell plane shift, more obscure planes and demiplanes often have rare tuning forks. The spell is highly imprecise, and you appear 1d20Ã—25 miles from the last place one of the targets (of your choice) was located the last time that target traveled to the plane. If it's the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, you appear at a random location on the plane. Plane shift doesn't provide a means of return travel, though casting plane shift again allows you to return to your previous plane unless there are extenuating circumstances.

target.value: 1 willing creature, or up to 8 willing creatures joining hands

description.value:
You create enough food to feed six Medium creatures for a day. This food is bland and unappealing, but it is nourishing. After 1 day, if no one has eaten the food, it decays and becomes inedible. Most Small creatures eat one-quarter as much as a Medium creature (one-sixteenth as much for most Tiny creatures), and most Large creatures eat 10 times as much (100 times as much for Huge creatures and so on).

Heightened You can feed 12 Medium creatures.

Heightened You can feed 50 Medium creatures.

Heightened You can feed 200 Medium creatures.

Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.
As you cup your hands, water begins to flow forth from them. You create 2 gallons of water. If no one drinks it, it evaporates after 1 day.
A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which it takes [[/r 1 # damage]] damage per hour until it leaves or dies.

Frequency Once per day. Effect The janni changes a creature's size. This works as a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Enlarge]{Enlarge} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Shrink]{Shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (Fortitude save negates).
